item.title: Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown Sold 1.3 Million Units in Its First Year
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/prince-of-persia-the-lost-crown-sales/

An Associate Marketing Director at Ubisoft has claimed that Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown sold 1.3 million units in its first year.

First spotted by X user Timur222, the Associate Marketing Director’s LinkedIn profile says that the game sold 1.3 million units in its first year, a number not too surprising as Insider Gaming reported in October 2024 that the game had sold approximately 1 million units in its first 9 months. The game sold 300,000 copies in its first month.

As reported then, the game failed to meet Ubisoft’s internal expectations, and a Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown sequel was not greenlit. Its team would move over to other Ubisoft projects, including Beyond Good and Evil 2, Project Over (a next mainline Ghost Recon game), and Project Steambot, a Rayman Remake in development at Ubisoft Milan.

The game received generally favourable reviews on launch across all versions of the game on review aggregator Metacritic and while the game failed to miss internal expectations is unknown, it’s likely attributed to Ubisoft’s recent public perception, which has dwindled in recent years due to poor decisions and a lack of understanding the current gaming landscape.

As for other Prince of Persia projects, the Sands of Time Remake continues development after being rebooted and is slated for 2026. Ubisoft has opted to completely know everything we know about the remake, including recasting the original actor Yuri Lowenthal.

item.title: A New Capcom Spotlight and Monster Hunter Wilds Showcase is Coming on February 4, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/monster-hunter-wilds-showcase/

Capcom has announced a new spotlight and showcase for February 4, showcasing Monster Hunter Wilds and a few other games.

The announcement says that the Capcom Spotlight and Monster Hunter Wilds Showcase will be approximately 35 minutes in length and will feature Onmimusha: Way of The Sword, Capcom Fighting Collection 2, and Marvel vs Capcom Fighting Collection Arcade Classics, following by a Monster Hunter Wilds showcase.

“Bringing you back-to-back info about all that’s coming from Capcom! First get the scoop on upcoming games from Capcom Spotlight, then tune in to the Monster Hunter Wilds Showcase for all the latest info! Both events will have subtitles available in 13 languages!” the announcement reads.

On Capcom’s official X (formerly Twitter) account, it’s said that the Spotlight will be roughly 20 minutes in length, whilst the Monster Hunter Wilds Showcase will be 15 minutes.

For those interested in a Monster Hunter Wilds Beta, Capcom has already announced that one will be taking place in early February. You can sign up to the beta here.

Monster Hunter Wilds is scheduled to launch on February 28, 2025 on the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series S|X, and PC.
